backend/main.mo: Motoko canister implementing user profiles, protagonist creation, persistent game state, quests, and dialogue systems with access control.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report mapping implemented gameplay features to frontend files, components, and test IDs.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Index of concise summaries for all frontend source files describing their roles in gameplay, UI, and state management.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind base and theme variables defining the app’s color palette and global styling for light and dark modes.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point setting up the root React mount and loading the main TypeScript bundle.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Main React app controller handling authentication flow, profile setup, character creation, and transition into the game.
frontend/src/character/CharacterCreatorS: UI for character creation allowing customization of appearance, personality traits, and background before saving to backend.
frontend/src/game/content/dialogues.ts: Defines dialogue scenes, nodes, and choices for NPC interactions including effects and conditions.
frontend/src/game/content/quests.ts: Lists quest definitions with objectives and rewards for the game's narrative progression.
frontend/src/game/dialogue/dialogueTypes: Type definitions for dialogue nodes, scenes, choices, conditions, and effects.
frontend/src/game/engine/NPCEntities.tsx: Renders NPC models and labels in the 3D world based on predefined placements.
frontend/src/game/engine/PlayerControlle: Handles player physics, movement controls, and camera tracking using Cannon and Three.js.
Tracks keyboard input state for player movement and jumping.
frontend/src/game/engine/WorldCanvas.tsx: Sets up the 3D scene, lighting, physics, and includes player, environment, and NPCs.
frontend/src/game/engine/WorldEnvironmen: Creates ground, boundaries, and simple environmental props with physics collision.
frontend/src/game/GameScreen.tsx: Main game UI combining 3D world rendering with HUD, dialogue, journal, and interaction logic.
frontend/src/game/npc/npcPlacements.ts: Defines NPC positions, appearance, and initial states in the game world.
frontend/src/game/state/useGameClock.ts: Implements a simple in-game clock that advances time continuously.
frontend/src/game/state/useProtagonist.t: Fetches protagonist data using a query hook.
Manages player position, nearby NPC detection, dialogue state, and time-of-day updates.
frontend/src/game/ui/DialoguePanel.tsx: Displays a dialogue scene with conditional choices, triggers quest additions, and advances through dialogue nodes.
frontend/src/game/ui/InteractionPrompt.t: Shows a small prompt instructing the player to press E to talk to an NPC.
frontend/src/game/ui/QuestJournalPanel.t: Renders a scrollable quest journal listing active and completed quests with objectives and progress icons.
Displays NPC relationship values using a compact card with progress bars.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Creates and manages the backend actor tied to the user's identity and refreshes dependent queries when it changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides context and utilities for managing Internet Identity login state and authentication.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Wraps backend actor calls in React Query hooks for user profiles, protagonist data, quests, and game state mutations.
frontend/src/index.css: Defines Tailwind layers and theme variables for light/dark modes and global styling.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Bootstraps the React app, wrapping it in Internet Identity and React Query providers.
frontend/src/profile/ProfileSetupModal.t: Renders a modal prompting the user to enter their name and submits it via a profile‑saving mutation.
frontend/src/title/TitleScreen.tsx: Displays the game's title screen with background, logo, and a login button using Internet Identity.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Provides utilities for reading, storing, and clearing URL and session parameters, including hash‑based routing support.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration defining theme extensions, color tokens, animations, and plugin usage.
project_state.json: Project metadata describing the game's vision, requirements, existing features, and image needs.
